intro: Vernonia quercifolia, commonly known as the oak-leaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its palmate, oak-like leaves and its tall, erect stems that bear clusters of small, blue-violet flowers. The plant is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy inflorescences. Vernonia quercifolia typically grows in moist, woodland areas and is often found in partial shade. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
